description: Set up React Router for client-side navigation with all required routes
steps: Step 1: Install react-router-dom dependency
Step 2: Configure BrowserRouter in App.tsx
Step 3: Create routes for /, /about, /now, /blog, /blog/:slug, /work
Step 4: Verify navigation works by clicking between routes

description: Create Layout component with navigation header
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/layout/Header.tsx with navigation links
Step 2: Create src/components/layout/Layout.tsx as page wrapper
Step 3: Add navigation items: Home, About, Now, Blog, Work
Step 4: Verify navigation appears on all pages

description: Implement theme toggle between light and dark modes
steps: Step 1: Create ThemeToggle component
Step 2: Create useTheme hook for theme state management
Step 3: Add theme toggle button to header
Step 4: Verify clicking toggle switches between light/dark themes
Step 5: Verify theme preference persists across page refreshes

description: Implement warm cozy color palette for dark mode
steps: Step 1: Create CSS variables in styles/variables.css with warm neutrals
Step 2: Set --bg-primary: #1a1814, --text-primary: #f5f0e8
Step 3: Set --accent-primary: #e8a854 (warm amber)
Step 4: Apply colors throughout the site
Step 5: Take screenshot and verify warm brown/amber tones instead of cyan/purple

description: Implement warm cozy color palette for light mode
steps: Step 1: Add light mode CSS variables
Step 2: Set --bg-primary: #faf8f5 (warm cream), --text-primary: #2d2820
Step 3: Set --accent-primary: #c9844a
Step 4: Toggle to light mode and verify warm cream background

description: Set up typography system with serif headings and comfortable reading sizes
steps: Step 1: Create styles/typography.css
Step 2: Set --font-heading to Fraunces/Georgia serif
Step 3: Set --font-body to Inter/system-ui
Step 4: Set --text-base: 1.125rem (18px) for comfortable reading
Step 5: Set --line-height-body: 1.7 for generous spacing
Step 6: Verify headings use serif font and body text is 18px

description: Create Home page with hero section
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/Home.tsx
Step 2: Add hero section with 'Hey, I'm Antony' greeting
Step 3: Add brief tagline (1-2 sentences)
Step 4: Add quick navigation buttons to About and Work pages
Step 5: Navigate to / and verify hero displays correctly

description: Remove typewriter effect and mouse follower from original site
steps: Step 1: Review App.tsx for typewriter animation code
Step 2: Remove typewriter effect implementation
Step 3: Remove mouse follower effect code
Step 4: Verify static text displays instead of animated typing
Step 5: Verify no cursor-following visual effects

description: Create About page with markdown content support
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/About.tsx
Step 2: Create content/about.md with frontmatter
Step 3: Add placeholder content sections: Short Version, Longer Story, What I Do
Step 4: Navigate to /about and verify page renders
Step 5: Verify markdown content displays correctly

description: Create Now page with markdown content support
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/Now.tsx
Step 2: Create content/now.md with frontmatter (lastUpdated, location)
Step 3: Add sections: Work, Learning, Reading, Building, Life
Step 4: Navigate to /now and verify page renders
Step 5: Verify lastUpdated and location display in header

description: Set up content directory structure for markdown files
steps: Step 1: Create content/ directory in project root
Step 2: Create content/blog/ subdirectory
Step 3: Verify directories exist and are tracked by git
Step 4: Add .gitkeep or example files if needed

description: Install and configure markdown processing dependencies
steps: Step 1: Install gray-matter for frontmatter parsing
Step 2: Install marked for markdown to HTML conversion
Step 3: Install shiki for syntax highlighting
Step 4: Verify all packages install successfully
Step 5: Run npm install and check package.json

description: Create markdown processing utility for blog posts
steps: Step 1: Create src/lib/content.ts
Step 2: Implement function to parse markdown with gray-matter
Step 3: Implement function to convert markdown to HTML with marked
Step 4: Add syntax highlighting with shiki
Step 5: Export utilities for use in components

description: Create blog index page listing all posts
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/Blog.tsx
Step 2: Load all blog posts from content/blog/
Step 3: Display posts in chronological order (newest first)
Step 4: Show title, date, description, and tags for each post
Step 5: Navigate to /blog and verify post list displays

description: Create blog post detail page with markdown rendering
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/BlogPost.tsx
Step 2: Use useParams to get slug from URL
Step 3: Load and parse markdown file matching slug
Step 4: Render post title, date, tags, and content
Step 5: Create test post and verify /blog/:slug displays correctly

description: Add Recent Posts section to home page
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/home/RecentPosts.tsx
Step 2: Load 3 most recent blog posts
Step 3: Display each with title, date, description
Step 4: Add 'See all posts' link to /blog
Step 5: Verify recent posts appear on home page

description: Create Work page migrating existing portfolio content
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/Work.tsx
Step 2: Migrate Experience section from App.tsx
Step 3: Migrate Projects section from App.tsx
Step 4: Migrate Publications section from App.tsx
Step 5: Migrate Skills section from App.tsx
Step 6: Navigate to /work and verify all sections display

description: Create Timeline component for work experience
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/work/Timeline.tsx
Step 2: Extract experience data from original App.tsx
Step 3: Render each job with company, role, dates, description
Step 4: Apply new cozy design styling
Step 5: Verify timeline displays correctly on /work page

description: Create ProjectCard component for portfolio projects
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/work/ProjectCard.tsx
Step 2: Extract projects data from original App.tsx
Step 3: Render each project with title, description, technologies, links
Step 4: Apply card styling with warm colors
Step 5: Verify projects display on /work page

description: Create SkillsGrid component for technical skills
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/work/SkillsGrid.tsx
Step 2: Extract skills data from original App.tsx
Step 3: Organize skills by category
Step 4: Render in grid layout with icons/tags
Step 5: Verify skills display on /work page

description: Add resume download button to Work page
steps: Step 1: Add 'Download Resume' button to Work page header
Step 2: Link to existing resume PDF
Step 3: Style button with accent color
Step 4: Verify clicking button downloads/opens resume

description: Create example blog post for testing
steps: Step 1: Create content/blog/2025-01-15-hello-world.md
Step 2: Add proper frontmatter (title, date, description, tags, draft: false)
Step 3: Add sample content with headings, paragraphs, code blocks
Step 4: Verify post appears in blog index
Step 5: Verify post renders correctly at /blog/2025-01-15-hello-world

description: Implement tag filtering on blog index page
steps: Step 1: Extract unique tags from all blog posts
Step 2: Add tag filter UI to blog index page
Step 3: Implement filtering logic when tag is selected
Step 4: Add 'Clear filters' or 'All posts' option
Step 5: Verify clicking tag filters posts correctly

description: Add reading time estimation to blog posts
steps: Step 1: Create utility function to calculate reading time from word count
Step 2: Add reading time to blog post header
Step 3: Display as 'X min read' below title
Step 4: Verify reading time appears on blog post pages

description: Implement 404 Not Found page
steps: Step 1: Create src/pages/NotFound.tsx
Step 2: Add friendly 404 message with navigation links
Step 3: Add catch-all route in router
Step 4: Navigate to non-existent URL and verify 404 page displays

description: Add back to blog link in blog post footer
steps: Step 1: Add footer section to BlogPost component
Step 2: Add 'Back to Blog' link pointing to /blog
Step 3: Style link with accent color
Step 4: Verify link appears at bottom of blog posts
Step 5: Verify clicking link navigates back to blog index

description: Implement active navigation link highlighting
steps: Step 1: Use useLocation hook to detect current route
Step 2: Apply active class to current navigation link
Step 3: Style active link with accent color or underline
Step 4: Navigate between pages and verify active link updates

description: Apply proper spacing and layout system throughout site
steps: Step 1: Define spacing variables: --spacing-page: 2rem, --spacing-section: 4rem
Step 2: Apply consistent page padding to all routes
Step 3: Add section spacing between major content blocks
Step 4: Verify generous whitespace and breathing room on all pages

description: Style cards with soft shadows and rounded corners
steps: Step 1: Create Card component in src/components/common/Card.tsx
Step 2: Set --border-radius: 12px for softer corners
Step 3: Apply --shadow-soft: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08)
Step 4: Use Card for project cards, blog post previews
Step 5: Verify cards have soft, warm appearance

description: Optimize blog post reading experience with prose styling
steps: Step 1: Create prose class for blog content
Step 2: Set max-width: 65ch for optimal line length
Step 3: Apply generous line-height: 1.7
Step 4: Style headings, paragraphs, lists with proper spacing
Step 5: Read a blog post and verify comfortable reading experience

description: Style code blocks with syntax highlighting
steps: Step 1: Configure shiki with appropriate theme (warm dark theme)
Step 2: Apply syntax highlighting to code blocks in blog posts
Step 3: Style code blocks with background and padding
Step 4: Add copy button to code blocks (optional)
Step 5: Verify code is readable with proper highlighting

description: Style blockquotes with warm, inviting design
steps: Step 1: Add blockquote styles to typography.css
Step 2: Apply left border with accent color
Step 3: Add padding and italic text style
Step 4: Create test blockquote in blog post
Step 5: Verify blockquotes stand out visually

description: Create Tag component for blog post tags
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/common/Tag.tsx
Step 2: Style as subtle pill/badge with border
Step 3: Use muted accent color for background
Step 4: Apply to blog index and blog post pages
Step 5: Verify tags display consistently

description: Style navigation header with clean, minimal design
steps: Step 1: Apply subtle background to header
Step 2: Add padding and proper link spacing
Step 3: Style links with hover states using accent color
Step 4: Make header sticky/fixed at top (optional)
Step 5: Verify header looks clean and inviting

description: Create Footer component with contact info and links
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/layout/Footer.tsx
Step 2: Add social media links (GitHub, LinkedIn, Email)
Step 3: Add copyright notice
Step 4: Style with muted colors and minimal design
Step 5: Verify footer appears on all pages

description: Optimize mobile responsive design for all pages
steps: Step 1: Add mobile breakpoints to CSS variables
Step 2: Test navigation on mobile (consider hamburger menu)
Step 3: Ensure proper text sizing and spacing on small screens
Step 4: Test blog posts for readability on mobile
Step 5: Test all pages at 375px, 768px, 1024px widths

description: Add smooth page transitions between routes
steps: Step 1: Add CSS transitions for route changes
Step 2: Implement fade-in effect when pages load
Step 3: Ensure transitions feel smooth, not jarring
Step 4: Navigate between pages and verify smooth transitions

description: Style links throughout site with consistent hover effects
steps: Step 1: Set link color to accent color (--link: #e8a854)
Step 2: Add hover color (--link-hover: #f4c076)
Step 3: Add underline on hover with transition
Step 4: Apply to all content links
Step 5: Verify links are visually distinct and responsive to hover

description: Ensure Cloudflare Workers SPA routing works correctly
steps: Step 1: Verify wrangler.json has not_found_handling: single-page-application
Step 2: Build project with npm run build
Step 3: Test preview with npm run preview
Step 4: Navigate to different routes in preview
Step 5: Refresh page on non-root route and verify it still works

description: Add SEO meta tags to each page
steps: Step 1: Create useDocumentTitle hook for page titles
Step 2: Add title tag for each route (Home, About, Now, Blog, Work)
Step 3: Add meta description tags where appropriate
Step 4: Add Open Graph tags for social sharing
Step 5: Verify page titles update when navigating between routes

description: Implement draft post filtering (don't show draft: true posts)
steps: Step 1: Check frontmatter for draft: true in blog posts
Step 2: Filter out draft posts from blog index
Step 3: Return 404 if accessing draft post directly
Step 4: Create test draft post
Step 5: Verify draft post doesn't appear in blog index

description: Add current status from Now page to home page
steps: Step 1: Extract key info from now.md (current work, location)
Step 2: Display in highlights section on home page
Step 3: Add 'Read more' link to /now
Step 4: Verify status displays on home page
Step 5: Verify link navigates to full now page

description: Optimize bundle size and performance
steps: Step 1: Run production build
Step 2: Analyze bundle size
Step 3: Implement code splitting for routes if needed
Step 4: Lazy load blog posts
Step 5: Verify build completes without warnings

description: Handle blog post loading errors gracefully
steps: Step 1: Add error handling when blog post not found
Step 2: Display friendly error message
Step 3: Add navigation link back to blog index
Step 4: Navigate to non-existent blog post slug
Step 5: Verify error message displays instead of crash

description: Add year groupings to blog index for archive organization
steps: Step 1: Group blog posts by year from date field
Step 2: Display year headers (e.g., '2025', '2024')
Step 3: List posts under respective years
Step 4: Add multiple posts from different years
Step 5: Verify posts are grouped correctly by year

description: Style hero section with warm, welcoming visual design
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/home/Hero.tsx
Step 2: Add large, friendly heading with serif font
Step 3: Style tagline with comfortable reading size
Step 4: Add subtle background gradient or texture (optional)
Step 5: Verify hero feels warm and inviting, not corporate

description: Create consistent button styling across site
steps: Step 1: Create src/components/common/Button.tsx
Step 2: Define primary style (accent color background)
Step 3: Define secondary style (outline/ghost variant)
Step 4: Add hover and active states
Step 5: Apply to all buttons (resume download, navigation links, etc.)

description: Test site thoroughly with keyboard navigation
steps: Step 1: Navigate site using only Tab key
Step 2: Verify all links and buttons are reachable
Step 3: Verify focus states are visible
Step 4: Test navigation with Enter key
Step 5: Verify skip links or focus management work correctly

description: Run Lighthouse audit and achieve score > 90
steps: Step 1: Build production version of site
Step 2: Run Lighthouse in Chrome DevTools
Step 3: Check Performance score
Step 4: Check Accessibility score
Step 5: Check Best Practices score
Step 6: Check SEO score
Step 7: Address any issues to reach >90 in all categories

description: Create comprehensive documentation in README for content updates
steps: Step 1: Document how to add a new blog post
Step 2: Document frontmatter schema for posts
Step 3: Document how to update About and Now pages
Step 4: Document build and deploy process
Step 5: Verify README is clear and complete

description: Test site in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
steps: Step 1: Test site in Chrome
Step 2: Test site in Firefox
Step 3: Test site in Safari (if available)
Step 4: Verify theme toggle works in all browsers
Step 5: Verify navigation and routing work in all browsers
Step 6: Document any browser-specific issues

description: Create example About page content
steps: Step 1: Write compelling personal story for About page
Step 2: Include sections: Short Version, Longer Story, What I Do, Outside Work, Values
Step 3: Add contact info and social links
Step 4: Review for tone (warm and personal, not corporate)
Step 5: Verify content displays correctly on /about

description: Create example Now page content
steps: Step 1: Write current status for Now page
Step 2: Include sections: Work, Learning, Reading, Building, Life
Step 3: Add last updated date and current location
Step 4: Link to nownownow.com explanation
Step 5: Verify content displays correctly on /now

description: Create sample blog posts demonstrating different content types
steps: Step 1: Create technical tutorial blog post with code examples
Step 2: Create personal reflection/thoughts post
Step 3: Create project showcase post
Step 4: Verify all posts display correctly
Step 5: Verify syntax highlighting works in technical post

description: Verify contact links work on About/Work pages
steps: Step 1: Add email link (mailto:)
Step 2: Add GitHub link
Step 3: Add LinkedIn link
Step 4: Add any other social media links
Step 5: Verify all links open correctly

description: Ensure visual hierarchy is clear on all pages
steps: Step 1: Check heading sizes create clear hierarchy (h1 > h2 > h3)
Step 2: Verify primary actions are visually prominent
Step 3: Verify supporting content is visually secondary
Step 4: Take screenshots of each page
Step 5: Verify information hierarchy is immediately clear

description: Set up proper error boundaries for React components
steps: Step 1: Create ErrorBoundary component
Step 2: Wrap main app in ErrorBoundary
Step 3: Display friendly error message on crash
Step 4: Test by intentionally throwing error
Step 5: Verify error boundary catches and displays fallback UI

description: Verify all images have proper alt text for accessibility
steps: Step 1: Identify all images on site
Step 2: Add descriptive alt text to each image
Step 3: Test with screen reader (if available)
Step 4: Verify images are meaningful or decorative as appropriate
Step 5: Run accessibility audit

description: Implement proper heading hierarchy for accessibility
steps: Step 1: Audit all pages for heading levels
Step 2: Ensure h1 is used once per page for main title
Step 3: Ensure headings don't skip levels (h2 after h1, not h3)
Step 4: Run accessibility audit
Step 5: Verify heading structure is logical and accessible

description: Add loading states for asynchronous content
steps: Step 1: Add loading spinner/skeleton for blog post loading
Step 2: Add loading state for blog index
Step 3: Style loading states to match theme
Step 4: Test on slow connection or with throttling
Step 5: Verify loading states display before content

description: Complete end-to-end test: user journey from home to reading blog post
steps: Step 1: Start at home page (/)
Step 2: Click on a recent post preview
Step 3: Read full blog post
Step 4: Click tag to filter posts
Step 5: Navigate to another post
Step 6: Click 'Back to Blog' to return to index
Step 7: Navigate to About page
Step 8: Navigate to Work page
Step 9: Verify entire journey feels cohesive and pleasant

description: Complete end-to-end test: theme persistence across navigation
steps: Step 1: Start on home page with default theme
Step 2: Toggle to opposite theme
Step 3: Navigate to About page
Step 4: Verify theme persisted
Step 5: Navigate to Blog page
Step 6: Verify theme persisted
Step 7: Refresh page
Step 8: Verify theme still persisted after refresh

description: Final visual polish: verify site feels cozy and personal throughout
steps: Step 1: Review all pages for warm color scheme (not cold/corporate)
Step 2: Verify generous whitespace and breathing room
Step 3: Verify typography feels personal and comfortable
Step 4: Verify interactions (hovers, clicks) feel smooth
Step 5: Verify overall aesthetic is 'cozy digital home' not 'corporate portfolio'
Step 6: Get feedback from user on cozy feel
